Detailed Description

The AMR/PCM player's base class.Get this player using AudioDeviceManager::GetAudioPlayer()

void StreamAudioPlayer::ReconstructRecordingWaitCondition (   )  [protected]
 

Reconstructs the wait condition member. Reason: Workaround for the following behavior of Timer: When it is used (Start()) from different contexts, it asserts. With the previous implementation of recording players, such a concurrency situation actually occurs. Dynamic recreation of the wait condition (and hence the Timer) works around the problem because the current execution context is set on construction time.

SharedPtr< AudioActiveReference > StreamAudioPlayer::Record (  const AudioReference &  audio_ref  )  [virtual]
 

Start recording. Below is the table which contains all the messages which could be emitted by APOXI at the beginning, during and at the end of recording

AudioRecordingStoppedMsgThis message will be emitted when the recording has stopped for some reason, it will not be emmitted the recording has been explicitly stopped
AudioStreamingSyncMsgIf the streaming instance was created using StreamAudioReference::CreateStream() function, the AudioStreamingSyncMsg APOXI Message will be sent after the first buffer is passed to DSP to be recorded

Parameters:
audio_ref A reference to the location to which the sound should be recorded.
Returns:
A reference to the active recording, for use with StopRecord() and the APOXI Messages.

void StreamAudioPlayer::SetRecordingDelay (  UINT32  delay  ) 
 

Set the recording delay. It might be possible that the recording has to be delayed for a couple of miliseconds This can be used to avoid recording of key tones or other sounds that have not finished when the recording start

Parameters:
delay The delay to be applied when the recording is started. See Record().

void StreamAudioPlayer::SetRecordingWaitCondition (  BOOLEAN  val = TRUE  )  [protected]
 

void StreamAudioPlayer::StopRecord (  AudioActiveReference &  active_reference  )  [virtual]
 

Stop recording. See Record(). If RAM has been set as media then StreamAudioReference::GetRecordedSize can be used to get the recorded buffer size

Parameters:
active_reference A reference to the active recording.
Note:
If streaming mode is used this function cannot be invoked from the callback function

BOOLEAN StreamAudioPlayer::StopSuspend_Implementation (  AudioActiveReference &  playing_reference  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Stops the suspended playback.
